answers.answer: I think thats very smart, actually. Too many girls want their little ones today when it just isn't time. Plus, its a mature decision to not do something dumb to induce or be induced. Good head on your shoulders(: good luck on the little blessing♡♡♡
Thank you :) . I mean i'm 38 weeks, 1 day...but I'm not miserable either..so I don't see a point in trying to naturally induce or be medically induce
Right!!?? (: I'm only 23 weeks, unless my baby and or I are dying, I need no medication or anything lol. I just think its a smarter choice! (:
All the more time in mamas belly the better! :) stick with it dont let anyone change ur mind!
Speaking of which.. I wonder what happened to the girl who took the castor oil at 35 weeks lol
I do too!

I don't want to be induced but since I have gestational diabetes my Dr. doesn't want me to go over due plus my body isn't getting there. My cervix isn't thinning out and I don't think I have dialated any more since 38 weeks.
i think being induced shouldnt be a choice, should only be offered if someone is way ovr due or if there is reasons the baby has to come early.
Right..like I said unless medically necessary! Which in your case, it is :)
Completely agreed!

Think of it like this its making ur body do something that it doesn't want to do!  Making the baby come when he or she isnt ready. A lot of the time ur body will reject it cause its not ready... & its ur body don't let the doc say something else to u if u don't think it feels right then don't do it. I went 6 days late w my second son and doc wanted to induce me ans I said I wanna wait and he said okay and my son came on his own. They should only do it of baby is stressed or getting to be then they may take u c section. Which I was scared of cause I didn't want to have one at all thank gosh I didn't lol my son was 9lbs 10 oz. Big ol boy haha ♥Good luck mama.
I am a ftm too so I don't really know what to expect or what contractions feel like so I have just been kinda waiting it out.
Thank you! Yeah...I'm a ftm. Tbh, I'm absolutely terrified of having a c-section, because even though I would be numb...the thought of being cut open while awake. Well scares the **** out of me!
You're due the day before I'm having my c section. And we have the same name hehe

Sammmmmmmme here and u cant see what's going on... I've never had one but I hear its very painful after:-/ & not the same when u do it vaginal its so amazing they hand u ur baby and ur just in lala land w u and ur baby but when its c section they don't let u hold ur baby they just show u... might be diff but its what people tell me
I had a csection with my daughter, they washed her up put her in a blanket and hat and handed her to me as the doc was sewing me up. I remember her first little cry sounded like a bird :')
♥ don't you love it♡♡♡♡
I do! Its completely amazing! I have21 days left til my second girl is here and i cant wait to do it all over again!
Im haveimg a water birth .. all natural ♡

My first pregnancy I went over 2weeks and nothing was happening and he wasn't kicking so I was induced and the nurse I had was not to great she gave me to much pitocin and made mine and my son's heart rates drop and I had to be rushed to emergency c-section and I didn't get to see or hold my son for almost 4 hours after he was born so I'm scared with this pregnancy but I get to actually try a vaginal birth with this baby unless I go past 41weeks so I'm praying I go into labor before then because my c-section was not a good one I had so many problems.
I don't plan to be induced either! Do research, women who get induced have a higher chance of needing a c-section.
What? Your allowed to choose if you want to be induced? I have never heard of that, I only thought you are induced if its medically needed for the baby to be out.. or if your 2 weeks over due....

In UK we can't choose to be induced we only have it if we're 2 weeks over due or if there are risks involved but even then they don't really seem to like it as they explained to me with my last baby when i had no choice but to have one, inductions are unpredictable they can work really fast or take forever and have a high rate of emergency c section being needed.  So your clever to not want one in my opinion, I'm praying not to go overdue as i don't want to be induced again :)

I was induced with both of my boys. My oldest son I had to be induced with because I was really young and he was a big baby and they didn't want me to be forced into a csection which would have had to happen if he got any bigger since I have a tiny frame to begin with and at that time my pelvic bone wasn't mature enough to spread. With my second son they induced me because they predicted he was going to be just as big as my first one and they had a fear he was going to have a BM inside me which could cause a lung infection for him or if its not caught it could kill both of us. With this pregnancy I want to experience everything I didn't get to with my others because this will probably be my last...so I want to avoid being induced at almost any cost for the simple fact that I want to know what its like to have my water break at home or while walking through walmart lol I want that story to tell. However both of my inductions went great so if it unfortunately comes down to needing one the only reason ill be upset is because I didn't get to experience natural labor. But I just want to make it known that there is a point where the baby can be in moms belly too long, hence so many fatalities during/because of child birth back in the day...and I'm not saying all of those are because the baby was in there too long but some are

I think that's a great idea. After watching what all that medication does to speed up labor does to the baby,  I'm DEFINITELY NOT interested in it. I will fight it out to the very end. I don't want pitocin, cervadil,  an epidural, none of that! My only concern is that my placenta doesn't move up. I really do not want a c section. But I'm praying things get better! Good luck with everything!  :)

Totally agree with not wanting to be induced unless necessary.  You can never be to prepared for your baby. I thought i had everything i needed when i had my first baby then bam the day we leave the hospital before we went home had to stop at target for swaddlers lol
The best way to avoid being induced is by going to a midwife

Its true if ur induced u do have a much highee risk of have a c section cause it stresses out the baby!  I've never been so worried/stressed untill 2 days before I had my second son cause I knew he was big and didnt want to b induced cause then I was thinking I have more of a chance of a c section which I'm so scared of! Hoping everything goes just as well this time around same to u mamas as well.There arw so many ways to put urself into labor the nurse who works at the officw told mw sex and spicy foods did sex never did anything for me so I ate a jack n the boxs hot mess burger w the spicy fries and went into labor that night of course had hurt burn but was just happy that he was coming on his own♡♡

I wouldn't recommend getting induced to anyone I was induced with my first he was 5 days overdue and I was getting signs of preeclampsia so my dr induced me pitocin for 8 hours and it took me from 1-1.5 then they put the cervadel in and I had that in for like 9 hours I was then at a 5 and they ordered my epidural I was in labor a total of 23& 1/2 hours it was hell I told my dr I don't wanna be induced this time unless absolutely necessary

Last time I went into labor by myself because my water broke. I wasnt dilating and my contractions werent consistent so theys started me on pitocin and she was out I think 8 hours after they started it. And I had an induction date set I believe a half week later because my husband was leavig the state for military training. This time I am hoping things happen on their own again and that my body will actually dilate on its own past a 3. I could care less if I'm induced or not but if I am induced unless necessary it will be after 40 weeks and no sooner.

I am so on the same page as you! I really dont want to have to go through that. I am due in 3 days and my baby girl is super low but I havent really had any signs of approaching labor -that I know of. :/ Hoping she comes on her own, and real soon!!

Reading your stories is the exact reason why I think its important to let baby come on his or her own.  Of course,  some of your stories..being induced was the best option.  I got checked a week ago and wasn't even dialated.  I live on the west coast and my mom lives on the east coast...she doesn't fly in til the 28th. I'm hoping my son stays put til she ishere.  I haven't had any labor signs just yet either

it all depends on where your mind is on this. Some people want it some people don't and some people's body take it and some don't. I've only heard a few good stories on being induced but have heard more not so fun storiesgood luck with whatever happens:)This was a good chat♥

The rezone people get inducted most of the time is because a doctor has a time limit if u have not given birth in 10 hours they dont want to waist more then that time and thats why you get induced and of course they will say it was completely necessary for the baby because they wont admit they dont want to waist time .. unlike a midwife ..
Go to youtube and watch the documentary The Business of Being Born its very informative and will answer a lot of your questions

question: I kinda feel like I am the only one who doesn't wanna be induced unless I really, really have to? Like if I go overdue. I have had an extremely healthy pregnancy..so its not medically necessary at this moment
title: Induction...?
